alert.note: Alert for South Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 08 at 2:40PM PST until November 09 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow above 4000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snowfall rates will lower later this evening and into tonight. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
